Posts.Content: campuzat wrote: My mom has mucinous carcinoma this time.  I think that is what she had 9 years ago.  what I read in her chart is this for the last time "Ductal Adenocarcinoma, Mucinous Adenocarcinoma".  This time it says "Colloid Carcinoma, Mucinous Carcinoma".  I have been trying to find out more about this type of cancer but the info is very little except that it is rare and very treatable.  But my questions are is this the same cancer?  can this cancer spread beyond the breast?  Is it normal that this is recurring?  I have many questions about her test results also.  This is what it says:  Grade- Nottingham Grade 1, Tubul- 2/3, Nuclea- 1/3, Mitoti- 1/3, 2% Low grade with out Necrosis, AJCC Tumor Cancer Staging: pT1b. I know that this means a small tumor but thats all.  Just so you know my mom was 47 the first time and she is 56 now.  Also the first time she had a lumpectomy and radiation.  This time she is having a mastectomy.  We have not seen a cancer doctor yet just the regular doctor and the surgeon.  Her surgery is next week.  what kind of treatments are possible for her now, cus i know she cant have radiation again?  Thank you for any and all information.  I am the type that wants to know everything.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: mucinous carcinoma info needed campuzat campuzat
